abstract: News website The Intercept will publish entire archive of internal National Security Agency newsletter drawn from Edward J Snowden's 2013 disclosure of NSA documents; articles describing agency's role in publicly known events are made available to journalists, who are encouraged to hunt for new stories and connections.
lead_paragraph: The news website began by posting 150 articles, offering a mixture of mundane accounts with operational updates written in plain English.

headline.main: The Intercept Publishes N.S.A.’s Internal Articles Detailing Employee Life
headline.print_headline: Internal Newsletter Items Detail N.S.A. Employee Life

snippet: The news website began by posting 150 articles, offering a mixture of mundane accounts with operational updates written in plain English.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
